Topic.Title: Why babyboomers SS & Medicare should be ended

Message.Msg: Everyone who wants to see baby boomers not get back what they put in listen up. Where was the big pat on the back in the 1970's and 1980's when million of baby boomers came of work age and paid billions of dollars INTO the system? Where was the thank you? NOW, all you read about or hear about is the millins of baby boomers about to retire and the drag that will create on the system. Baby boomers listen up, take at least your dividends out of your IRA's or 401K's on a quarterly basis, pay the current marginal tax rate on the withdrawals. I'm telling you here and now, the chances the marginal tax rates will go up at least 10% by the time you retire, is 100%. PLUS, how do you know, there won't be an ASSET TAX, or reduced benefits because you have a small nest egg. It's best to hide what you have, by taking it Off Paper Statements, and sticking the cash under your mattress. Not all of it, but some at least.

Topic.Title: Why babyboomers SS & Medicare should be ended

Message.Msg: Wait a minute. Obama ended the wars right? When he came into office in 08, the nation was 9 trillion in debt. So let's see. Now we are 17 trillion in debt. Wars caused this increase? Anybody with dividend income in an IRA or 401K, why (1) are you reinvesting those dividends at 52 week highs and (2) why are you letting them just go back into an account that could be taxed at higher marginal rates down the road. I can see the day in not to distant future, where "tax the rich" means even if you have $100,000 in a retirement account, not just INCOME, but ASSETS! It's called Means Testing. The days this will occur, WILL CRATER THE MARKETS! Plan Ahead people, Plan Ahead

Message.Title: A financial plan that makes sense
Message.Msg: Say you're 65, with $200,000 in various investments. Begin by figuring out your healthy life expectancy. Say it's 85. Where are you going at 85 right? Golfing? Jamaica? Now, figure with conservative dividends, you can make 4% per year on that $200,000 or 8,000 a year. Withdraw the $8,000 a year divi plus 1/20 of the $200,000 principal or total of about $18,000 a year to do what you want with. Trips, cars, whatever. Enjoy it. Then when you are 85, you will have nothing left as an investment, but your house or car or anything you purchased with your withdrawals. You'll still get Social Security to live on. Why be the richest man in the graveyard? At least the government won't confiscate what you don't have too.

Message.Title: I'm preparing for national financial chaos in coming years
Message.Msg: The coming financial Armageddon will make 2008 financial collapse look like a Sunday school picnic. Have enough cash on hand to pay all your basic necessities, food, clothing, utilities, for 6 months. When the governmment confiscates your savings (for the good of all), closes the banks with no prior notice, shuts down the ATM's coincedent with the bank closures, you will be ready and not have to panic. Just because something has never happened doesn't mean it will never happen. I hope it doesn't but if it does, be ready.

Message.Title: Apple Devices To Outsell Windows For First Time Ever In 2013
Message.Msg: On slashdot now... ======================== "Mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets have long been considered the future of computing and a new projection from market research firm Gartner shows just how important the mobile market has become. According to the firm's estimates for 2013, Apple devices will outsell Windows devices for the first time this year. Message.Title: Microsoft Dying? I Don't Think So
Message.Msg: Google it... The author shows some relevant charts of performance over the past decade or so. The problem is that, any investment advisor will tell you, past performance is no guarantee of future performance. The current hoo-ha is about projections of future performance. Further, the author says little to nothing about recent deviations from long-term past performance, except to blame them on recent economic woes. But as everyone knows, even after taking those woes into account, Microsoft has been faltering, and PC sales have been levelling off and even falling. So, despite this author's protestations, there is good reason to believe Microsoft is in deep trouble.

Topic.Title: Apple Devices To Outsell Windows For First Time Ever In 2013

Message.Msg: Isn't Gartner a year or so behind with this announcement?: vanityfairPOINTcom/business/2012/08/microsoft-lost-mojo-steve-ballmer Scroll way down -- “I see Microsoft as technology’s answer to Sears,” said Kurt Massey, a former senior marketing manager. “In the 40s, 50s, and 60s, Sears had it nailed. It was top-notch, but now it’s just a barren wasteland. And that’s Microsoft. The company just isn’t cool anymore.” Cool is what tech consumers want. Exhibit A: today the iPhone brings in more revenue than the entirety of Microsoft. No, really. One Apple product, something that didn’t exist five years ago, has higher sales than everything Microsoft has to offer. More than Windows, Office, Xbox, Bing, Windows Phone, and every other product that Microsoft has created since 1975. In the quarter ended March 31, 2012, iPhone had sales of $22.7 billion; Microsoft Corporation, $17.4 billion."
